page.title: 05PILTANTON BURN
page.content: When the burn enters the study area it is 1/3 of the way along its course. At this point the{PILTANTON}is full of reeds, the water is reasonably clear and the muddy bottom is visible. There is also a large amount of slime. As the burn continues on its course the reeds remain plentiful and the water becomes murky obscuring the bottom. The visible stones are covered in mosses and slime. As it passes a derelict dam the burn develops a fusty smell, but this soon disappears. When the burn runs under the bridge at{ {LOCHANS}village the water has cleared, due to an increase in width and a reduction in depth, this allows the bottom to come into view. The burn there is polluted with rubbish such as wheels and cans. The number of reeds has decreased but there is still alot of slime.
